items.title: RFP for Mental Health Diversion Peer Services Evaluation Consultant
items.summary: The County of Sonoma Department of Health Services, Behavioral Health Division (BHD) is requesting proposals to provide evaluation services for a new Mental Health Services Act Innovation program: Crossroads to Hope. Crossroads to Hope serves eligible criminal justice diversion clients who have a serious mental health illness and may have a co-occurring substance use disorder

items.title: Weekly Roundup for March 11, 2022
items.summary: Today’s digest provides helpful and important updates on the following: 1) Local COVID vaccine & testing opportunities; 2) CDPH information on “Long Covid” health condition; and 3) Other County of Sonoma news of note.

items.title: County accepting applications for American Rescue Plan Act funding through April 7
items.summary: Sonoma County has opened the American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) Notice of Funding Availability process to accept applications for ARPA funding through April 7. The county has allocated $34 million to support community resilience programs that address community needs identified as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. The county is prioritizing applications that address systemic public health and economic challenges contributing to the unequal impact of the pandemic on certain populations.

items.title: Weekly Roundup for March 4, 2022
items.summary: Today’s digest provides helpful and important updates on the following: 1) California SMARTER plan underway; 2) Local COVID vaccine & testing opportunities; and 3) Other County of Sonoma news of note

items.title: Napa/Sonoma Pesticide Regulation Community Workshop March 9-10, 2022
items.summary: Join this session to learn how pesticides are regulated and how laws are enforced across multiple state and local agencies to ensure the protection of human health and the environment.

items.title: RFP for Medical Director Services for Juvenile Institutions and Valley of the Moon Children’s Home
items.summary: The evaluation panel carefully reviewed and analyzed the proposals received in response to the above referenced solicitation. Based upon that review and analysis, we are recommending to the Sonoma County Board of Supervisors that the contract be awarded to Santa Rosa Community Health.

items.title: Weekly Roundup for Feb. 25, 2022
items.summary: Today’s digest provides helpful and important updates on the following: 1) California formally shifts to endemic strategy; 2) New law requires companies to provide paid sick leave for COVID; 3) State urges people to donate blood, save a life; and 4) COVID-19 vaccine & testing opportunities in Sonoma County.

items.title: Sonoma County health officials issue cold weather warning
items.summary: The County of Sonoma is issuing a cold weather warning in response to the National Weather Service’s prediction of freezing overnight temperatures on Tuesday, Feb. 22 through Friday, Feb. 25. Temperatures are expected to drop to the upper 20s and 30s for most areas. Cold temperatures will impact the homeless and those without adequate heating.

items.title: One millionth dose of COVID-19 vaccine administered in Sonoma County
items.summary: One million doses of COVID-19 vaccine have now been administered in Sonoma County, a new milestone in the 14-month-long campaign to strengthen residents’ immune systems against the deadly virus. The county Department of Health Services announced today that a total of 1,000,594 doses of Pfizer, Moderna and Johnson & Johnson vaccines have been administered in Sonoma County since the vaccination campaign began in December 2020. That includes first, second and booster doses.

items.title: Tina Rivera to be appointed director of Sonoma County’s Department of Health Services
items.summary: Tina Rivera, a veteran government official and nonprofit leader with more than 25 years of experience delivering health care and social services to the public, has been named director of the Sonoma County Department of Health Services following a nationwide recruitment search. The Sonoma County Board of Supervisors is scheduled to vote to confirm her appointment for a three-year term at its March 1 meeting.

items.title: Weekly Roundup for Feb. 18, 2022
items.summary: Today’s digest provides helpful and important updates on the following: 1) Large vaccine clinics at Sonoma County Fairgrounds; 3) What to do if you contract COVID-19; 4) Vaccine & testing clinics in Sonoma County; 5) COVID-19 community resources & support.
